gobblin.runtime.mapreduce

Class MRJobLauncher.TaskRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper<org.apache.hadoop.io.LongWritable,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable,org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable>
      • gobblin.runtime.mapreduce.MRJobLauncher.TaskRunner
  • Enclosing class:
    MRJobLauncher

    public static class MRJobLauncher.TaskRunner
extends org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper<org.apache.hadoop.io.LongWritable,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable,org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable>
    The mapper class that runs assigned WorkUnits.

    The map(org.apache.hadoop.io.LongWritable, org.apache.hadoop.io.Text, org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper<org.apache.hadoop.io.LongWritable, org.apache.hadoop.io.Text, org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable, org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable>.Context) method de-serializes a WorkUnit (maybe a MultiWorkUnit) from each input file and add the WorkUnit (or a list of WorkUnits if it is a MultiWorkUnit to the list of WorkUnits to run. The run(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper<org.apache.hadoop.io.LongWritable, org.apache.hadoop.io.Text, org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable, org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable>.Context) method actually runs the list of WorkUnits in the TaskExecutor. This allows the WorkUnits to be run in parallel if the TaskExecutor is configured to have more than one thread in its thread pool.
